name: The Beardmore Hotel & Conference Centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked dinner, bed and breakfast for an overnight stay. £17.50 per person charge for dinner from a reduced menu. The choice was good, the presentation and food were superb. The choice of hot and cold food at breakfast was excellent and the freshly made toast was a nice touch. Heather at reception was particularly helpful although all members of staff were pleasant and efficient.
reviews.title: Great overnight stay

reviews.text: I would thoroughly recommend the Beardmore for a delightful meal without the hassle of a taxi home.
reviews.title: Hotel near the river Clyde

reviews.text: My wife and I spent one night in this hotel, as it is adjacent to the Jubilee hospital and as she was having surgery early morning we decided to stay over and save the drive through early traffic. The room was very good and very clean, the only slight down side was the Television which was quite small.
reviews.title: Amazing again!

reviews.text: This was our second visit to The Beardmore and we loved it as much as the first time. Both times we have stayed in an executive suite and the rooms are perfect.
reviews.title: Excellent value and location.

reviews.text: We had a 2 course dinner included in our package but after going for a swim we had asked if we could have it as room service instead of going to the restaurant. That was not a problem. We were able to choose anything up to the value of £35 between the two of us from the room service menu which was brilliant.
reviews.title: High standard

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel as part of a Skills tour to the Tattoo. Our stay at the hotel was an horrendous experience The first night we had dinner in the hotel in a separate room from the rest of hotel I asked the restaurant manager for Wine List and was told to go to the bar to ask for it and that took about 20 minutes to find the bottle I had chosen. The meal was appalling especially the main course which was chicken, the pudding was fruit salad this was like the fruit you would serve at breakfast, others guest were served frozen cheese cake After dinner we went to sit in the lounge and this was full and we went to sit in the dining room chairs but we were told we couldn't sit and were send to the reception area. I complained to the Duty Manager and she said she would sort out and come back to me. I am still waiting for this. The second night we didn't have dinner in the hotel as we were at the Tattoo, we did try to have a drink in bar but there was a wedding reception and no space sit in bar ,again we were very rudely told by the staff we could not sit on the restaurant chairs and were send to unfriendly reception area. The breakfasts were very poor with cold bacon and poor quality bread , we had taken a Swiss friend with us and there was no cheese or meats for her. The single room for my Swiss friend had a stained carpet . The double room that we had was ok except on both days the towels in bathroom were for one person instead of two. I have never stayed in a hotel with such bad mannered staff and this was not the impression I wanted my foreign guest to experience of Scottish hospitality.
reviews.title: Visit to the Edinburgh Tattoo 2nd Aug for 2 nights

reviews.text: Stayed at the Beardmore for one night on business and found a very good hotel on the edge of an industrial estate joined to a hospital.
reviews.title: Great hot in strange location

reviews.text: Once you are past reception it turns into a proper four star hotel with all you would expect find in a quality hotel, with clean well appointed rooms.
reviews.title: Overnight stay whilst having a wee op!

reviews.text: An Apple computer in the room you can surf the net and watch TV on is a brilliant idea.
reviews.title: Restuarant was brilliant

reviews.text: The only let down here is the breakfast, lots of choice but when I went down at eight thirty the cooked breakfast looked very tired as if it had been out on display far too long.
reviews.title: Very friendly and courteous staff

reviews.text: had a 3 night stay and was pleased about it as it was a lovely hotel.. the family rooms were big, clean, king beds are comfy, good restaurant, and nice swimming pool, was initially confused as this has access to the hospital but it was well posted in their big lobby where the hospital/hotel is.. lovely view by the lake and the grounds Are very big and our children enjoyed playing around on a very sunny morning. i will definitely recommend and will come back again soon!
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.text: The Great Western Road is one that goes on & on but eventually we turned into the grounds of the Beardmore Hotel. It is right beside a private hospital and was built to accomidate families of the patients.
reviews.title: A room with a View

reviews.text: It is a large stylish building with a more than adiquite amount of parking availability.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We were greeted at the check in by a young lady, multi tasking, but efficently found our room and key.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Once inside our room we found everything one would want when on the road. Loads of plugs, a selection of lighting, an Apple TV/ computer in white. The room was very well laid out with two stylish upholstered chairs as well as another at the dressing table. The decor completed by pictures, a pleasant room with plenty of space to move around. Free wifi, that worked. Everything to make a brew including a biscuit Just great, experience. The real star of the room was the view of the River Clyde and the Mammoth Crane. £10 a room more, but for us well worth it.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: A truly wonderful hotel, the rooms are enormous and spotlessly clean with beautiful views, lots of little extras within the room including an imac and great internet connectivity. The hotel is bright and airy with lots of beautiful marble, the grounds are impressive with plenty of parking facilities and the staff are extremely warm and welcoming, there is plenty of choice on the menu including a la carte and breakfast is very impressive with a great choice, food is hot, fresh and delicious. Rates are extremely competitive considering the quality of rooms and leisure facilities available, you can pick up a room from as little as £55, £65 including breakfast, cheaper if you book ahead. Highly recommend staying at this hotel, business or pleasure whenever in the area, definitely worth a visit!!!!
reviews.title: Superb Hotel - Great For Business Or Pleasure

reviews.text: My cousin and I stayed at the Beardmore for 3 nights between 18th July and 21st July 2013, in room 419. Our stay started off very well, when the hotel shuttle car picked us up from Glasgow Airport. The facilities are truly four star. The room overlooks the Clyde, so too does the largest restaurant. It was very quiet, spacious, clean and has a very comfortable king-size bed, a big sofa, iMac, luxurious carpets, decor and bathroom. The food was excellent; we had slices of lovely homemade bread with our excellent dinner at their smaller restaurant. The reception, restaurant and cleaning staff were all professional and helpful; however, two members of staff were exceptionally so and warrant a special mention: the head of the breakfast staff was a very professional, welcoming, pleasant, friendly and helpful gentleman. The other excellent staff member was Anne who went beyond the call of duty by offering us a lift to the nearby Dalmuir train station and also told us about nearby tourist attractions, such as Loch Lomond, which we visited and enjoyed very much. There are regular, inexpensive trains from Dalmuir to Glasgow Central/Queen Street Stations and regular buses to Balloch( for Loch Lomond). We really enjoyed our stay and we will definitely stay there again. I have already recommended this hotel to all my family and friends. A very big thank you to all the staff members we encountered during our stay.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT HOTEL, FOOD AND CUSTOMER SERVICE!

reviews.text: Stayed in what turned out to be one of the disabled rooms, and I was huge. Very clean, small fridge for using as well which was a bonus as staying with a two year old and was ideal for storing her food. Great having access to an iMac in every room too. Huge double bed, good parking facilities, and out of the way of the busier parts of Glasgow. Would definitely stay again web visiting for a weekend shopping.
reviews.title: Great for easy access into the city

reviews.text: Stayed here with our family. Very impressive rooms - larger than I expected, pristine condition with a good layout. Was a nice touch to find an iMac in each room.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: Restaurant staff were helpful and provided good service.
reviews.title: Best staffed hotel in the west of Scotland

aka: The Beardmore Hotel And Conference Centre
description: The Beardmore Hotel and Conference Centre, on the banks of the river Clyde, is the perfect location for your next getaway whether it be for business or pleasure. Located just 20 minutes from Glasgow city centre, a short drive to Glasgow International Airport and easy access to the historic beauty of the Loch Lomond and Trossachs National Park. The Hotel shares its grounds with a National Medical centre.
